title: Services Domain Schema
description: Schema for the Services domain in the Orthogramic Metamodel

title.description: The name or title of the Service
examples: Rail Freight Transport Service
Customer Support Portal

description.description: A detailed explanation of what the Service entails
examples: End-to-end freight transportation service using the national rail network

purpose.description: The intended purpose or benefit of the Service
examples: To provide reliable, cost-effective freight transportation solutions

owner.description: The individual or team responsible for the Service
examples: James Wilson, Director of Freight Operations

orgUnitTitle.description: The Organization unit the Service belongs to
examples: Freight Operations Division

serviceLevelAgreements.description: The SLAs associated with the Service
examples: 98% on-time delivery, maximum delay of 2 hours for priority shipments

channels.description: The channels through which the Service is provided

customerFeedback.description: The methods for collecting and analyzing customer feedback
examples: Post-delivery satisfaction surveys, annual customer interviews

processFlow.description: The sequence of activities and interactions that comprise Service delivery
examples: Booking request → Cargo inspection → Loading → Transport → Tracking

customerJourney.description: The touchpoints and experiences throughout Service delivery
examples: Inquiry → Quote → Contract → Scheduling → Tracking → Delivery

dependencies.description: Other Services, systems, or resources required for Service delivery
examples: Track maintenance services, locomotive fleet management

stakeholderNetwork.description: The individuals or groups involved in or impacted by Service delivery
examples: Shippers, receivers, rail network operations team

performanceIndicators.description: Metrics used to measure Service effectiveness and value delivery
examples: On-time delivery percentage, customer satisfaction score

continuousImprovement.description: Methods for gathering and implementing Service improvements
examples: Quarterly performance reviews, customer feedback integration

resourceManagement.description: Required resources for consistent Service delivery
examples: Locomotive allocation system, crew scheduling software

riskManagement.description: Identified risks to Service delivery and mitigation strategies
examples: Weather contingency plans, security protocols for high-value cargo

strategicAlignment.description: How the Service supports Organization objectives and outcomes
examples: Supports national freight mobility goals, carbon reduction initiatives

qualityFramework.description: Standards and procedures for ensuring Service quality
examples: ISO 9001 certified operations, monthly safety inspections

valueStream.description: Mapping of how value flows through the Service delivery process
examples: Initial customer inquiry → Contract → Service delivery → Invoice

complianceRequirements.description: Regulatory and Policy requirements affecting Service delivery

targetAudience.description: Primary users or beneficiaries of the service

examples: 24/7 tracking, business hours customer support

capacity.description: Service capacity limits and scaling capabilities
examples: Maximum 500 concurrent shipments, auto-scaling for peak seasons
Per-mile rates, volume discounts, premium service surcharges

competitiveAdvantage.description: What differentiates this service from alternatives
examples: Real-time tracking with 99.5% accuracy, carbon-neutral options

integrations.description: Systems, platforms, or services this service integrates with
examples: ERP systems, warehouse management, GPS tracking platforms

automationLevel.description: Degree of automation in service delivery

examples: Horizontally scalable with cloud infrastructure, seasonal capacity planning

innovationOpportunities.description: Areas for service innovation and enhancement
examples: AI-powered route optimization, blockchain-based tracking
Carbon offset programs, electric vehicle integration
Multi-language support, disability-friendly interfaces
End-to-end encryption, role-based access control
Reduce transportation costs by 25% while improving delivery reliability

successMetrics.description: Key metrics that define service success
examples: Customer retention rate, Net Promoter Score, first-call resolution

changeManagement.description: Approach to managing service changes and updates
examples: Phased rollouts, customer communication, training programs

knowledgeManagement.description: How service knowledge is captured and shared
examples: Service documentation, best practices database, training materials

marketPosition.description: Desired market position in the service category

investmentLevel.description: Required investment level for service delivery

examples: Improved safety for passengers, reduced costs for operators

parentService.description: Parent service this is derived from
examples: Enterprise Customer Management Platform
Mobile Customer App, Partner Portal Service
Development: $500K, Annual operations: $150K

revenueModel.description: How the service generates revenue or value
examples: Annual service fees: $100K, Premium features: $25K
Monthly active users: 2,500, Feature utilization: 85%
Error rate: 0.1%, Customer satisfaction: 4.5/5
1,200 active users across 15 departments

usage.description: How the service is typically used
examples: Daily operations support, weekly reporting, monthly planning

relatedServices.description: Services that are related or linked
examples: Customer Analytics Service, Billing Management Service
Node.js, PostgreSQL, React, AWS cloud infrastructure
Add mobile notifications, implement chatbot support
Q2: AI integration, Q4: Advanced analytics dashboard
Available in English, Spanish, French with local compliance

serviceFeatures.description: Specific features or components of the Service

title.description: The name or title of the Service feature
examples: Real-time Cargo Tracking

description.description: A detailed explanation of what the Service feature entails
examples: GPS-based tracking system providing customers with real-time location updates

purpose.description: The intended purpose or benefit of the Service feature
examples: Provide transparency and certainty about cargo location and arrival times

owner.description: The individual or team responsible for the Service feature
examples: Sarah Johnson, Head of Digital Services

orgUnitTitle.description: The Organization unit(s) involved in the Service feature
examples: Technology and Customer Experience Department

serviceLevelAgreements.description: The SLAs associated with the Service feature
examples: 99.5% system uptime, location updates every 15 minutes

channels.description: The channels through which the Service feature is provided

customerFeedback.description: Methods for collecting feedback on this feature
examples: In-app feedback option, usage analytics, satisfaction surveys

userExperience.description: Description of user interaction and experience
examples: Intuitive interface with real-time map visualization and status updates
Update frequency, accuracy rate, user engagement, satisfaction score

dependencies.description: Technical or business dependencies for this feature
examples: GPS infrastructure, mobile networks, database systems

integrationRequirements.description: Integration needs with other systems or services
examples: ERP integration, mobile push notifications, third-party mapping services
Encrypted data transmission, secure authentication, access controls
Screen reader support, high contrast mode, voice commands
Reduces customer inquiries by 40%, improves satisfaction scores
Phase 1: Basic tracking Q1, Phase 2: Advanced analytics Q3
Daily monitoring, weekly updates, quarterly system maintenance
Auto-scaling infrastructure, handles 10,000 concurrent users
Data privacy compliance, location sharing consent
Predictive delivery times, IoT sensor integration, AI-powered insights

targetAudience.description: Specific users or groups for the feature
examples: Customer service representatives, field technicians, managers
User adoption rate, error reduction, time savings, satisfaction score
Initial users report 30% time savings and improved accuracy

costs.description: Development and operational costs for the feature
examples: Development: $50K, Annual maintenance: $10K
Integration complexity, user adoption challenges, data quality issues
